trans-unit.source: A block-level flow content element that provides a grid-based presentation organized by rows and columns.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.Table> derives from the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Block> element, and adheres to the common rules for containing a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Block> element.
A <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Table> element may be contained by any of the following elements:
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.Table> is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid> element but has more capabilities and, therefore, requires greater resource overhead.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Table"></xref> class.
Called before an element is initialized.
Gets or sets the amount of spacing between cells in a table.
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*double*
String representation of a <xref:System.Double> value equal to or greater than **0.0** but smaller than <xref:System.Double.PositiveInfinity>.
An unqualified value is measured in device independent pixels.
Strings need not explicitly include decimal points.
*qualifiedDouble*
A *double* value as described above, followed by one of the following unit specifiers: `px`, `in`, `cm`, `pt`.
`px` (default) is [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-dipixelsharpplural-md.md)]
`in` is inches; 1in==96px
`cm` is centimeters; 1cm==(96/2.54) px
`pt` is points; 1pt==(96/72) px
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
The amount of spacing between cells in a table, in device independent pixels.
The default value is **2.0**.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Table.CellSpacing"></xref> dependency property.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TableColumnCollection"></xref> object that contains the columns hosted by the table.

The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableColumn> objects returned by this property can, in conjunction with the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableCell> objects in the column, be used to define layout of columns but they do not determine the actual number of columns rendered.
It is the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableCell> objects in a table that determine how many columns are actually rendered.
For example, if you define 3 columns but only have table cells for 2 columns, only 2 columns will be rendered.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TableColumnCollection"></xref> object that contains the columns (represented by <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TableColumn"></xref> objects) hosted by the table.
Note that this number might not be the actual number of columns rendered in the table.
It is the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TableCell"></xref> objects in a table that determine how many columns are actually rendered.
This property has no default value.
Called immediately after an element is initialized.
Gets an enumerator that can be used to iterate the logical children of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Table"></xref>.
Child objects are enumerated in the following order:
Columns (represented by <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableColumn> objects).
Row groups (represented by <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowGroup> objects).
An enumerator for the logical children of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Table"></xref>.
Creates and returns an <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> object for this <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Table"></xref>.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.OnCreateAutomationPeer%2A>.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> object for this <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Table"></xref>.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TableRowGroupCollection"></xref> collection object that contains the row groups hosted by the table.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TableRowGroupCollection"></xref> collection object that contains the row groups (represented by <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TableRowGroup"></xref> objects) hosted by the table.
This property has no default value.

Gets a value that indicates whether or not the effective value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Table.Columns"></xref> property should be serialized during serialization of a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Table"></xref> object.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Table.Columns"></xref> property should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.
Adds a child object.
The child object to add.
Adds the text content of a node to the object.
The text to add to the object.
